title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\ExtractJobConfiguration
name: ExtractJobConfiguration
description: Represents a configuration for an extract job. For more information on the available settings please see the Jobs configuration API documentation.

params.name: config
params.description: A set of configuration options for a job.

params.name: location
params.description: The geographic location in which the job is executed.

methods.name: compression
methods.description: Sets the compression type to use for exported files.

params.name: compression
params.description: The compression type. Acceptable values include "GZIP", "NONE". Defaults to "NONE".

methods.name: destinationFormat
methods.description: Sets the exported file format. Tables with nested or repeated fields cannot be exported as CSV.

params.name: destinationFormat
params.description: The exported file format. Acceptable values include "CSV", "NEWLINE_DELIMITED_JSON", "AVRO". Defaults to "CSV".

methods.name: destinationUris
methods.description: Sets a list of fully-qualified Google Cloud Storage URIs where the extracted table should be written.

methods.name: fieldDelimiter
methods.description: Sets the delimiter to use between fields in the exported data.

methods.name: printHeader
methods.description: Sets whether or not to print out a header row in the results.

params.name: printHeader
params.description: Whether or not to print out a header row. Defaults to true.

methods.name: sourceTable
methods.description: Sets a reference to the table being exported.

methods.name: useAvroLogicalTypes
methods.description:
Sets whether to use logical types when extracting to AVRO format.

If destinationFormat is set to "AVRO", this flag indicates whether to enable extracting applicable column types (such as TIMESTAMP) to their corresponding AVRO logical types (timestamp-micros), instead of only using their raw types (avro-long).

methods.name: dryRun
methods.description:
Sets dryRun flag. If set to true, don't actually run this job. A valid query will return a mostly empty response with some processing statistics, while an invalid query will return the same error it would if it wasn't a dry run.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Whether or not to execute as a dry run.

methods.name: jobIdPrefix
methods.description:
Sets a prefix for the job ID.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: jobIdPrefix
params.description: If provided, the job ID will be of format {$jobIdPrefix}-{jobId}.

methods.name: labels
methods.description:
Sets the labels associated with the job. Labels can use these to organize and group jobs. Label keys and values can be no longer than 63 characters, can only contain lowercase letters, numeric characters, underscores and dashes. International characters are allowed. Label values are optional.

Label keys must start with a letter and each label in the list must have a different key.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

methods.name: location
methods.description:
Specifies the geographic location of the job. Required for jobs started outside of the US and EU regions.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: location
params.description: The geographic location of the job. Defaults to a location specified in the client configuration, if provided, or through location metadata fetched by a network request (by calling Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::reload(), for example).
